website_summaries.verdict: Reliable performance in a low-priced nailer. Can only use smaller finish nails, but does this well.
pros: Able to drive nails ranging in length from 1 to 2.5 inches
Aimed more at home users than contractors
Can adjust the direction of the exhaust so it doesn't blow the air back into your face
cons: Limited to 16 gauge straight finish nails
Some problems with nails jamming inside machine

customer_reviews.title: Works but Could Be Better
customer_reviews.text: I was initially going to give it 2 stars because I could not get the gun to drive the nails deep right below the surface. Tried to increase the air pressure but still no good. Adjusted the dept on the gun but nails still weren't being driven down far enough. I finally removed the rubber cover on the tip and finally the nails were driven as deep as I needed them to go. Once off, the gun worked as I was expecting it; however, i had to remove the tip in order for that to happen. They probably need to make the rubber cover a bit thinner so it doesn't affect the nail depth.
customer_reviews.author: gtorres

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer for outdoor DIY projects
customer_reviews.text: When I placed the order, I was concerned about the quality b/c of their price vs market price for any of the "big brand" 16 gauge nailers. I just finished this small project, fired off at least 1000 nails (in the summer heat, humidity & afternoon showers of Atlanta) & still going strong! It works much better & has more features than my "Harbor Freight house brand" nailer, and expectedly falls short of my $180 Hitachi nailer. This NuMax nailer met and far exceeded my expectations for the price I paid, hence the 5 stars. Plus I now can save my expensive nailers for indoor projects & furniture making.
customer_reviews.author: Haroon Qureshi

customer_reviews.title: Worked awesome
customer_reviews.text: My first experience with a nail gun. It worked perfectly with no jams at all. Built an entire wall with pallet wood at it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Brian cupari

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Finish Nailer
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat this NuMax finish nailer for the money. I have used this nailer to finish out a new remodeled room with no problems. Have used 1.5 to 2.5 inch 16 gauge nails. I did have to turn up the compressor air pressure to 120 psi to countersink most of the longer nails. A few go in flush so I use a punch to manually sink them. Also has to do with angle/position of the gun when driving. Not really an issue. I also have a NuMax framing nailer that I am very pleased with. A few drops of oil at the start of each job and there are no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Dan J

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Needed to take off and paint all the baseboards in my house. The price just to rent one from Home depot was $39 for the day. Paid $28 for this gun and It worked great! Was able to take my time and nail all the board back on with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for a DIY homeowner, not for a Pro
customer_reviews.text: I have a number of remodeling projects coming up and needed a finish nailer. I have several nailers made by a company that rhymes with "Shorter Table", however, recent reviews of their products are distinctly negative. Higher-end, professional nailers are going for $250+ so I said what the heck and bought this. It did well on casing out several windows. As others have mentioned, it often does not sink the nail fully so you have to go back and finish with a hammer and nail punch. Overall, for the price you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: John66

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have had this years ago
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this nailer for a specific project for a volunteer group. We were building a number of boxes from wood reclaimed from pallets. We nailed the first few using hammer and nails, but it was taking quite a while to complete the work. I found this nailer on Amazon - good price and very functional. I went through several thousand nails on the project, switching between 1.5 and 1.75 length nails, with only one jam in the nailer. That jam was easy to clear, and we moved on with the project quickly. I know we could not have completed the project in the time allotted without this nailer.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: works fine for shooting 2 inch nails through 3/4 inch maple flooring into 1 inch subfloor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for installing 3/4 inch maple flooring down on 1 inch plywood subfloor. I don't need to use it a lot, just for the couple of rows that are too close to the wall to use my flooring nailer. So far I've shot 150 or so nails and it's been working fine. no jams or misfires yet. I'm using Porter Cable nails. I've used only 18 gauge before and these appear about twice the size with heads that I think are even more then twice the size of the 18 gauge heads. So I think this is a nice step up in holding power over the 18 gauge.
customer_reviews.author: WishIWasOnMyBike

customer_reviews.title: Works...
customer_reviews.text: This one is a little different than others I've owned in that the trigger pull punches the nail no problem, but the release is the guns exhale. Different, but I got used to it pretty quickly. Most nails set perfectly, but as your tank nears it's refill point they don't set as nicely. For the home gamer - totally worth the price, with good performance, and quality results. If you're a pro, this thing should hold up for the long haul.
customer_reviews.author: b'dub

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable finish nailer
customer_reviews.text: My previous finish nailer stopped working (HDX) so I bought this. This price is on the lower end of the spectrum but it worked great. More expensive ones are lighter and have better ergonomics. If you are on a budget or don't are about that stuff this is a great option. It shot finish nails without any issue at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Only had it a week, but works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I'm redoing a porch and wanted something to put v-match on the ceiling. I got this thinking if it lasts long enough to do the ceiling, it's worth the insanely low price I paid for it. I'm 2/3 done with the ceiling and it shows no sign what-so-ever of any problems or issues. It currently drives finish nails as well as an unit that costs 5 times as much; yesterday a contractor friend brought his over and we used them alternately - same compressor, hoses, etc, the only thing that changed was the nail gun. Time will tell about longevity, but so far I'm delighted with this finish nailer.
customer_reviews.author: Ragnorok

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, fast and efficient
customer_reviews.text: I always hated hammering in finishing nails, the trim bounces around, the nails don't hold, it's slow, and turns out ugly. This really helps! One shot and it's in, plus holds well. Works great for trim and little wood pieces. I got it to install hardboard in my basement (think pegboard). Problem is that the hardboard is more like thick paper than wood, and the nails go through it too easily. I eventually got it working by adjusting the tool's adjustments and dropping psi below recommended level. Of course that's not necessary for most projects, but it can be done!
customer_reviews.author: Redque

customer_reviews.title: Great gun and great price.
customer_reviews.text: I was leary of this brand, but the reviews were decent. I'm not sure why I was weary as I was using a 10 year old Campbell Housfeld that died, but I just needed it for around the house and not everyday use. The price was right, and it almost exactly like the one it replaced. So far have gone through a good 500 nails with no issue. Even bought the same brand framer, just waiting for it to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: A. Margis

customer_reviews.title: The nailer constantly jams. leaves deep and wide holes.
customer_reviews.text: This Nailer is not worth the money. The Unit jams on every 3rd nail. I tried multiple batches of nails, fresh oil, different air pressure and even used my other nailer with all those same settings,. My other nailer worked, this one does not. In addition to the jamming problem, the unit leaves an obscenely large hole to fill after the nail does go in. I recommend you go with a name brand unit.
customer_reviews.author: F. Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Pneumatic 16 gauge nailer.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to put some baseboards back up after removing them to redo large drywall patch on wall. This nailer will get very little use so the price point was perfect. Baseboard was made up of 3 pieces of molding. This nailer handled all 3 different size and shapes of molding in an excellent manner. Don't know what it would be like in heavy use, but I will never use it in that manner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trouble with nails not sinking.
customer_reviews.text: I could not get this to adjust to counter sink 2-1/2 inch nails. Cranked the adjustment knob as far as it would go but it still leaves them shy of the surface. Had to remove rubber protector to get them even flush. Plenty of air pressure. Would return it but I made it work for my molding job, not right to return it when done. If anyone else has a better idea I'm all ears.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Decent Nailer
customer_reviews.text: This nailer will punch 3 1/2 inch nails right in, if you hold it tight. It works and is pretty reliable so far. I bought a NuMax brad nailer after this. It shoots 16 gage 2 1/2 brads. Both work fine. But the brad nailer is more awesome than the framing nailer. Both are a good value. My campbell Hausfeld broke some internal plastic parts in the piston and gas system. Hope this one will be better. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: KNRS

customer_reviews.title: Great handyman tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gun instead of a name-brand gun because I’m not a professional and I don’t expect to be using it every day. I’ve run over 3,000 nails through it with no complaints. It sinks 2” nails and 3-1/2” nails with equal ease. No regrets here. I oil it when I pick it up and I oil it before I put it away, and so far it looks like it will last ‘forever’ at my level of use.
customer_reviews.author: dr. cliff

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and delivers nails without much pressure, and as an older woman, I appreciate the light weight of this gun. I do wish someone would invent one that is smaller and can get into tighter spaces.
customer_reviews.author: reinventress

customer_reviews.title: Very good product, powerful, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I was very cautious with using this product in the beginning because it looked a little intimidating. My friend helped me connect the compressor to the hose and with a little help from YouTube, I was able to load the nails. Much much easier than I’d expected. Compatible with dewalt’s nails. Very easy to use but must at least read the manual for safety precaution because this thing is powerful. Didn’t encounter jamming.
customer_reviews.author: Y Ho

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Does everything that my Porter Cable did before dying after 20+ years for a fraction of the price. I only use for home projects and expect it will hold up for my needs but if you are a professional perhaps you want one of the major brands.Did not come with a case but I modified my original Porter Cable case using a heat gun and all is well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: 8clap

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, most excellent price
customer_reviews.text: I have used this nailer for about three weeks and put a couple thousand nails through it. I have had no jams, stutters, or double shots. I am exceptionally happy with this tool that I paid 1/3 the cost of the name brand I usually purchase. I took a gamble and finally won. I recommend this tool as high quality with excellent performance.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Nailed it
customer_reviews.text: Just finished my first crown molding project with this nailer. Has ran perfect the whole time, no issues. Took it out of the box, loaded it, and have ran about 200 nails through it without a hiccup. I put 2 drops of oil (included) in the inlet after each sessions and cycle it to get the excess oil out, but other than that, no maint requirements so far.
customer_reviews.author: Benchtest

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good nailer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this nailer mostly for putting up trim and moulding . I got it used it one time and it quit shooting nails but i contacted amazon and they sent me another one with free return service and they shipped me the new one before they received mine back . the new one has been working with no problems at all I already got my moneys worth i had a porter cable nailer before this that was alot more expensive and it didn't last very long we will see how long this one lasts but so far so good totally worth the price for the DIY er
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Hornsby

customer_reviews.title: Trouble free
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this NuMax air nailer because of the great use I have received from their framing nailer. This finish nailer has been just as dependable. My only quibble with it is that it is not easy to tell when you are out of nails.
customer_reviews.author: tnscoutr

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: The only negative comment I can give is; why on earth did I wait so long to get one of these things. As to the Numax SFN64, it is more than I expected. I've been practicing with the 2.5 inch nails and they are amazing. I've been adding nails to projects in my shop and just stand back and think, why have I been pounding these nails all this time with a hammer? So far, I can't say enough about this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Miss V.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for occasional work around the house.
customer_reviews.text: I had a difficult job installing trim for two doors in an old house with everything out of square. To help make the job easier I bought the NuMax. I was a little nervous about buying it because it was priced cheap. But it worked smoothly and I was please with how easily the trim was installed. The NuMax finish nailer is a real bargain. If I did this type of work for a living I'd probably a higher grade nailer. But for amateurs like myself, its the right tool for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's good!
customer_reviews.text: This nailer is a very good value. It's made pretty well with an economy of features but it performs properly day after day for me. It's good. Don't waste your money on the DeWalt or Metabo or other pricey guns. Get one of these it works just as good and you usually don't need all extra features
customer_reviews.author: AmznAtomic724

customer_reviews.title: Puts through 2 1/2 inch nails great. Has been through 1
customer_reviews.text: Puts through 2 1/2 inch nails great. Has been through 1,000 nails so far with the following issues: Sometimes a nail will not fire - you have to pull the trigger again if you can't see a jam. Once in a while you get 2 nails driven. I would recommend this as a home product, not something for heavy duty use.
customer_reviews.author: Kinetic Web Design

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on a tool that just plain works!
customer_reviews.text: It is not often that you buy a tool that just works great at a bargain price, but this is one of those tools. I bought this for a project to build a base for a project I was working on, out of 1 x 4's (and a 2 x 4) and it performed flawlessly out of the box. Way easier than pounding nails by hand. No jams, used my Porter Cable 150 Pancake compressor and at about 100lbs psi drove 2 1/2" finish nails flush like a champ. Great little nailer.
customer_reviews.author: BlackDogTX

customer_reviews.title: Good for price.
customer_reviews.text: I have used it now on several projects. I have had no jambs as other reviews have stated. I will say that compared to my old gun this replaced which was a Porter Cable that it lacks the drive power. To many times will the nail head not drive into the molding where my other gun I would dive enough for filler. Good gun just lacks drive power.
customer_reviews.author: David Benson

customer_reviews.title: Not contractor grade but OK
customer_reviews.text: It works fine for projects around the house. Longest nails I've used were 2" in solid wood crown molding and some of those required setting another 1/8" or so even with air pressure at 100 psi. I keep it oiled and haven't experienced any real problems with it so far. I've used over 1000 Porter Cable nails.
customer_reviews.author: William V

customer_reviews.title: nice gun
customer_reviews.text: I am a diy'er who has done a lot of woodwork and construction. This is the 3rd nail gun I have bought (2 other types/manufacturers). For the money...it seems like I made a good choice here. It is a bit heavy...but I will not be using it every day. It seems like a winner.
customer_reviews.author: duckman

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a future project. I should have tested it out sooner, unfortunately Amazon's return window for this product closed. Upon using this nail gun i was able to get 3 nails out after that the trigger wouldn't work at all. For that reason i find it to be poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Uncertain trigger...
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit. Loads easily. Worked well on bench driving nails downward. Tried to use it on ceiling crown molding and the safety mechanism falls out of alignment and blocks the trigger action. Very inconvenient when your other hand is holding a length of molding.
customer_reviews.author: dB

customer_reviews.title: Looking good
customer_reviews.text: Have only done a few shots with it but it seems to work very well. Plenty of power even for 2" nails. It replaces my old 16 gauge unit from the mid 90's. Easy to load nails and easy jam clearing method. Will do update when it has been used more. 2 months later after a big job. It worked flawlessly as I rebuilt the entrance porch woodwork after the flood. Good solid gun.
customer_reviews.author: Pahabrin

customer_reviews.title: Great Nailer for the Price
customer_reviews.text: For a 63 year old woman, trying this for the first time was a bit scary, but fun. I really liked it. It worked great. It did jam twice, but not a problem. This is my new favorite tool. I was a bit worried it would be too heavy - but it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: K. Turner

customer_reviews.title: great tool for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to shoot some nails a 1/2" longer than my Senco nailer but didn't want to spend the Senco dollars. This gut is well made, durable, and quite effective. Shoots a 16 gauge 2 1/2" nail and sets the head (depth is adjustable) in hardwood. Probably won't outlast the Senco but I will rarely use it so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Holden

customer_reviews.title: Glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I have been using air nailers for a long time, of course, when I retired the guns I used the most were worn-out. When I decided to put down a new floor in the master bath, the head gasket blew-out. Didn't want to spend $200 on a pro gun so, I ordered this one. Glad I did. Good little gun for the money. Not for daily use but, many years of home use.
customer_reviews.author: polar

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I finally moved up to the 16 gauge nailer and what a difference. This is a well built solid tool, and the increase in holding power between the cheap 18 gauge and this 16 gauge is huge! Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: pablo arnoldo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect didn't even have to adjust nail depth oUT of ...
customer_reviews.text: 50 cheaper than horror freight one. But works awsome. My air compressor is cranked to the max 125 psi and I use a 30 gallon tank. Not one misfire other than when I forget to reload nails. Already shot a couple hundrend 1 1/2 Bostic brand nails hanging paneling and molding on a remodel job. Perfect didn't even have to adjust nail depth oUT of box. I'm super pleased.
customer_reviews.author: mollyringwald

customer_reviews.title: Air leak in housing
customer_reviews.text: While the nailer worked still, I could hear a “hissing” noise from within the casing from the first moment I connected it to the air line. Judging from the reviews, this isn’t common so I might test my luck with a replacement, which is why I did 2 stars and not 1. This air leak caused my compressor to run more then it should have, even while not being used.
customer_reviews.author: Travmo.

customer_reviews.title: Happy I did
customer_reviews.text: I had my old porter cable stolen in a robbery. Was going to replace with the same (which is around $150) but thought I would try this. Happy I did. It works perfectly and for less than 1/2 the price. Maybe not up to professional use but for a home reno its perfect. 100's of feet of baseboards installed and no jams, no fails, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Grteat value
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a Porter-Cable that blew a gasket. This was cheaper than a repair would have been, and it has served well in the limited use it gets. A little heavier, but not a problem. Seems well made.
customer_reviews.author: David C

customer_reviews.title: Price is right
customer_reviews.text: The price is right for this finish nailer. I have had no problems. It is lightweight and easy to use. I am using this for the trim work in my basement. If you have an air compressor to power it, this is the one to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Canon Hound

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this nailer to install some wood plank interior boards in a cabin. The walls went up with only one jam in the gun during the whole project. Overall this is a good product for the money. I recommend it to anyone in need of this type tool.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this NuMax SFN64. I didn't want to spend a lot of money since it was mainly a project I needed to complete in the home but for the price this really impressed me, worked great and got the job done really fast.
customer_reviews.author: NorCaban

customer_reviews.title: Replaced a Porter Cable nail gun that the trigger valve went bad on. Used with Porter Cable 2" 16G nails
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is competent tool. The only down side is it needs to be oiled. Used with a 150 PSI/6 Golan tank. Tested it with 3/4 inch hardwood scrap. Went through 3 boards stacked up. Proceeded to use it installing crown molding. Replaced a Porter Cable nail gun that the trigger valve went bad on. Used with Porter Cable 2" 16G nails. No Jamming yet.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: My Porter Cable trigger came apart last time I used it. I am getting a replacement trigger kit for like $20. I saw this gun for $44 and figured I’ld give it a try. Just did all new baseboard in my house and this gun performed just as well if not better than my Porter Cable! 4 stars because I have to see if it lasts and keeps performing. So far I am very impressed. No jams, no malfunctioning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gun!
customer_reviews.text: You will not find a better value anywhere. I have used nailers with many brand names, wearing much bigger price tags. This one (initially at least) is up to the challenge. Easy controls, nice features. It works for this professional handyman!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Britton

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, low cost.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. Not had any problems with the nailer. I only have a limited amount of use for this, installing trim and did not.want to make a big investment. Does a good job of not splitting the trim.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Pick

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had this nailer long but for the money it is working nicely. I run a custom woodworking shop and have a number of expensive nailers and this one I'd say is as good as any of the big name nail guns. Hope it last.
customer_reviews.author: H. Piper

customer_reviews.title: Terrific tool
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old Dewalt finish nailer with the NuMax and was stunned to discover... I like it better. Solidly built, easy to load. Used for a pretty large finish job, no jamming, great performance. Terrific tool for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Zuckerman

customer_reviews.title: I like everything about this nail gun but unnecessary depth wheel
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this nail gun but unnecessary depth wheel. I have this wheel dialed at max depth and compressor set north of 100psi and it won’t drive 2.5” 16 gauge finish nails thru crown molding into wall studs (leaves ~3/8” sticking out). Yet my friends industry standard name brand name guno sets them perfect with same psi. Given the amazing reviews and rating here, I may give it one more shot before spending double on the name brand - we’ll see.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Gill

customer_reviews.title: just used this and it worked great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a project and it worked great and is well worth the cost. If you google it you'll find a lot of great reviews for this very reasonably priced tool, theres no case or anything but for the money, Im happy to have a great tool that works- worth the money for sure!
customer_reviews.author: A. Bottorff

customer_reviews.title: Jammed on second nail
customer_reviews.text: One nail and it jammed. Brought this to replace an old nailer. Didn't use it for a couple months after buying. First use... arrow brand nails jammed and too late to return. Disgusted.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Dryer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive - Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: My regular nailer went down in the middle of a project. A rebuild kit was not available for several weeks. I purchased this nailer to finish the jot. It was inexpensive and performed well.
customer_reviews.author: fatz2fly

customer_reviews.title: You get MORE than what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Super gun for the price. Compared to similar guns, this is priced as practically a throw away, but performs as a keeper. I'm a cabinet installer and only 2 jams through a few hundred nails. Would/will buy another when/if this one fails
customer_reviews.author: Laffertycool

customer_reviews.title: seems to work well enough
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, only had one misfire (just had to remove a plate and pop out the stuck nail). You do have to be a bit careful as to the angle you use when putting in angled trim but that's probably true for any nail gun. The one niggle it seems to have is that the rubber protector on the end of the safety tip could be a little more secure, it tends to want to slide off.
customer_reviews.author: Ano223

customer_reviews.title: Value and function.
customer_reviews.text: A value, no-name imported brand tool, but it does the job. No case. Loading nails is not intuitive, but reading the instructions it is easy once you figure it out. Comes with small, cheap oil bottle that was empty and really too cheaply made to be of use.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Bisogna

customer_reviews.title: You wont find a better price for a nail gun.
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with my purchase, for a nail gun under 50 dollars you really cant beat it. I have used it several times and it works flawlessly. As far as longevity I still cant answer but so far im really pleased with the gun.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Garbage, Got it to install baseboard , it just doesn't work. Had to re insert the trigger wire many times. Even for the price it's a waste of money Skip it.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar DeSouza

customer_reviews.title: It shoots nails but not a good finish
customer_reviews.text: No matter what pressure I put my air tank on it would splinter the top of the wood. Occasionally there would be a clean finish but that was not the norm. I installed hardwoods with an engineered finish and would recommend buying a more expensive gun for that project.
customer_reviews.author: Pete R Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your use
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble getting nails to set. was shooting 2.5" nails through a door jamb and had to go back and set half of them with hammer when done. Unacceptable. cranked it up to Max PSI it was rated for and set it to drive as deep as it would. still no luck.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer S.Top Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: i had fun using this tool and i have to say it was very easy to use. drove the nails through with no effort.
customer_reviews.author: shaupp

customer_reviews.title: Great Nail Gun at a fraction of the store prices!
customer_reviews.text: We have used a lot of finish nails remodeling our kitchen. Our old gun quit working right when we were ready to start building our new kitchen table. The local store prices were 3 times the price we paid for this one. It works great! No complaints at all! Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Great little gun
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it for two years and haven’t had any problems. Shoots different length finish nails. Recently changed all the baseboard in my house and this was the only nail gun I used. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: No worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: First one defective second one died on 7-15-19, very light use. Spend more and get something that will last. Pros: Price Con: Foot to Protect work leaves marks. Poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Appolas

customer_reviews.title: Great product and pleasantly surprising price!
customer_reviews.text: Numax has a very good product. I have used other “name brands” in the past and can say without a doubt Numax stands toe-to-toe with the competition at a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Bucksnort Rick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I put nails in everything now. EVERYTHING.
customer_reviews.author: DrThunder

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer
customer_reviews.text: It's been a great finish nailer. I've run 1-1/2" and 2" nails through it. It is easy to set up, adjust, and use. Not heavy, so extended use is doable. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stratton

customer_reviews.title: Constantly jams or shoots multiple nails.
customer_reviews.text: Constantly jams. Tried 1 1/4" and 1" nails. Many times shoots two nails or jams. The depth adjuster is useless. Regardless of setting nails sometimes go in deep, flush or stick out2/8". I would not recommend this products.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Easy and works well
customer_reviews.text: Me and my husband ordered this while we were redoing our daughter's bedrooms. We needed a nail gun for the baseboards and this worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Heartsongs<3

customer_reviews.title: worked very well.
customer_reviews.text: My last 16 gauge nailer stopped working most likely because I only use it once or twice a year. I think the seals dried out. Bought this one to install beadboard ceiling on a porch. Used stainless nails and the gun worked very well. For the price it was worth it even just for this one job.
customer_reviews.author: DS-Portsmouth VA

customer_reviews.title: Good nailer
customer_reviews.text: Works decent and is very affordable. Shoot slow for proper depth.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: My First Nailer/Works Great on my Basement Project
customer_reviews.text: This is my first air nailer and I had never used one before. The tool is light weight and easy to handle. It’s quiet and powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Suspicious of it being "New"
customer_reviews.text: This product has obviously been opened and used before. Box was ripped and there was no sign of any tape type seal. Nailer was lose in box. Can't imagine this is actually "New". Will test once compressor gets here.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hollenbach

customer_reviews.title: Got ripped off!
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for my needs. Very disappointed to find it being sold for half the price i paid for it just 2-1/2 weeks later!
customer_reviews.author: Jdarlink

customer_reviews.title: Nailer for the rest of us
customer_reviews.text: If you are a weekend warrior this is the finish nailer for you. I use it on a regular basis but not constantly. I have only had the unit jam once on me and it easily disassembles to remove the jammed nail. The no mar tip is great. It'd be nice if they offered the option to get a hard case for a slightly higher price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: NuMax SFN64 Straight Finish Nailer
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for hubby, he likes it for the job he was doing. Great price, better then any of the stores around us. Arrived very quickly and well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Kimi Pyles

customer_reviews.title: Works great. The pneumatic plunger and o-ring seem to have ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The pneumatic plunger and o-ring seem to have a very solid and smooth action when shooting the nails. I've ran a little less than 100 nails through it, but it seems like it would hold up great on a decent sized project. I love that they sent a little bottle of oil along with the nail gun. The little extras go a long way with me.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome nailer!
customer_reviews.text: My vintage Porter Cable lost a pin in the middle of a job - couldn't repair it. Got this as a substitute to finish the job. A fraction of the price of the PC unit. Works great. $32! Looks remarkably like the newer PC unit at $150+
customer_reviews.author: Necky McStifferson

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with its quality and functions. Used this to install hardwood flooring to nail along the tongue when I couldn't use a traditional floor nailer. Drove about 200+ nails and no jams. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: I buy alot

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with tool
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this nailer to renovate my son's house. So far, I'm quite satisfied with it's performance. Decent tool for low price.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Koch

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the best options on Amazon. Don't know the brand but I trust the gun it worked great so far. Had to change out the make nozzle on the gun for a different size I just grabbed the right size from an old tire valve adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: This brad nailer is ready for the garbage can
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to get this nailer, had a project I was working on. With the performance of this nailer it would have taken several weeks to finish. It would drive two nails and jam, had to clear the jam, shoot 2 brads and jam. Was ready to throw in garbage, instead sent it back in for a refund. By far the worst product i have gotten from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poorly built!
customer_reviews.text: Shot 25 nails, then the roll spring holder broke off and now it is just a paper weight. Unlike the Porter Cable guns, this one is riveted together and cannot be repaired. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: James Troxell

customer_reviews.title: Junk junk
customer_reviews.text: When I returned the first one while getting a refund some how they send me a nother one I tried to stop them shipping it but wasn't able to, not a good tool.
customer_reviews.author: John Merrifield

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Crap Nailer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to unJam, Easier to Jam. Jammed repeatedly, sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Clare

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little nailer. I have been wanting a finishing nailer for a while but I didn't want spend alot of money so this one was perfect. I've used it on several jobs and I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Davy

customer_reviews.title: Works really well. No jams so far
customer_reviews.text: This gun is proof that competitors' guns can be way overpriced. This gun has worked well since I first used it.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great Price on this unit. Great Nailer
customer_reviews.text: Great nailer. I’ve shot a couple of thousand nails so far. Only jammed when I hit another sub nail. Then really easy to unjam.
customer_reviews.author: CApt B

customer_reviews.title: Came jammed already , nail on top of nail
customer_reviews.text: Came jammed from amazon . I have not loaded a single nail . It is jammed from being preloaded before I received it have not been able to fire it one time incredibly stupid to sell an item line this from the factory .
customer_reviews.author: Hurikane

customer_reviews.title: Nice nail gun
customer_reviews.text: Husband uses for wood projects. Likes this one vs the other models he has. Working great and no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great gun!! I was worried about it being very cheap like. But it is actually very well put together and the weight is just right.. it's not made of some cheap plastics.. handle is nice it's rubber and fits into my hand perfectly.. highly recommend if you are just a hobbyist or doing projects around the house..
customer_reviews.author: melesa

customer_reviews.title: Great air nailer for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price. Used it to install a tongue and groove pine ceiling. No problems thus far. Works as it should. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: smp

customer_reviews.title: Not as elegant as the better nailers but the pneumatic nailers and compressors are soon ...
customer_reviews.text: Surprised at how well this thing works. Just little projects so far but no problems so far. Not as elegant as the better nailers but the pneumatic nailers and compressors are soon to be things of the past so I wouldn't spend much on one anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spend a few more bucks.
customer_reviews.text: The price seem good but this is no where near the finish nailer that my Senco is. Really, spend a few dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: don

customer_reviews.title: Great finish nailer
customer_reviews.text: I use this nail gun frequently in my shop and it works great. Rarely ever gets a jam and has all the features you need in a finishing nailer. There are more expensive brands but for the money you can't beat this nailer especially for the hobbyist woodworker.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: The product was delivered quickly and I'm happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this nailer as a replacement for my broken one. It is working well so far and it was ready for use outside the box. It came with hose adapter and oil which is all that's needed for immediate use. The product was delivered quickly and I'm happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: CoolPlace

product_meta.title: NuMax SFN64 Pneumatic 16-Gauge 2-1/2" Straight Finish Nailer Ergonomic and Lightweight Nail Gun with Tool-Free Depth Adjust and No Mar Tip
product_meta.description: The NuMax SFN64 Pneumatic 16-Gauge 2-1/2" Straight Finish Nailer is ideal for applications such as decorative trim, furniture trim, rail molding, crown molding, window casing, door installation, base boards, chair rails, picture frame assembly, and hobbies and crafts. Compatible with 16 gauge straight finish nails from 1" to 2-1/2", This air powered nail gun features a quick jam release for fast clearing in the event of a jammed fastener, along with a tool-free finger depth adjust for various applications. An ergonomically engineered die cast aluminum body makes this rugged and lightweight finish nailer easy to operate over extended periods of time. The comfort grip handle and No mar safety tip ensure great results by increasing precision and preventing damage to your working surface. A one piece drive blade of hardened steel adds to the durability of this nail gun. Air tool oil and adjustment tools are included. The Pneumatic 16-Gauge 2-1/2" Straight Finish Nailer is an essential tool for DIYers at home as well as professional contractors at the job site.
feature_bullets: Nailed It: This pneumatic 16-gauge straight finish nailer features a lightweight and durable aluminum body, and an ergonomic comfort grip handle. A no mar tip prevents dents and dings, and the quick jam release lets you easily clear jams without taking the nailer apart.

Many Uses: This finish nail gun is great for interior and exterior finish and trim, furniture, cabinet work, staircases, base boards, shoe and crown moulding, window casing, and chair rail moulding. Sequential firing and tool-free depth adjust allow you to customize for any project.

The Right Tool for the Job: We're committed to providing outstanding value, top tier customer service and long lasting, high quality products. We make nailers and staplers for every purpose, from roofing to siding to flooring and everything in between.

Quality and Durability: We manufacture tools with the most durable materials under strict quality control guidelines, suitable for professional contractors and do-it-yourselfers alike. Our tools are sold, distributed, serviced, and warrantied in the USA.

Tough and Dependable: We make an array of durable construction tools and accessories, including staplers and nailers for siding, flooring, framing, finish, and roofing. Compare our products to similar items by Makita, Hitachi, Bostitch, Senco, Paslode, and Dewalt.

specifications.Included Components: Pneumatic 16-Gauge 2-1/2" Straight Finish Nailer; Air Tool Oil; Adjustment Tools
specifications.Warranty Description: 1 Year Limited Warranty and 30 Day Wearable Parts Warranty
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars939 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
